alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 31 at 8:52PM MST until January 02 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM SUNDAY TO 8 AM MST MONDAY ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 6000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches, with as much as 18 inches above 8000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 6000 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Heber-Overgaard and Williams. * WHEN...From 5 AM Sunday to 8 AM MST Monday, with snow levels lowering to near 7000 feet including Flagstaff around mid day Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact holiday travel as well as the morning and evening commute for those working Sunday. Snow forecast from 5 AM Sunday to 8 AM Monday: Doney Park 2 to 4 inches Flagstaff 5 to 9 inches Forest Lakes 9 to 15 inches Heber-Overgaard 2 to 4 inches Williams 6 to 10 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Western Mogollon Rim
